Class RequirementModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.AbstractListModel<Requirement>
      • edu.wpi.cs.wpisuitetng.modules.planningpoker.requirement.models.RequirementModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.ListModel<Requirement>

    public class RequirementModel
extends javax.swing.AbstractListModel<Requirement>
    List of Requirements being pulled from the server
    Author:
    tianchanggu

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static RequirementModel getInstance()
        Returns:
        the instance of the requirement model singleton.

      • addRequirement

        public void addRequirement(Requirement newReq)
        Adds a single requirement to the requirements of the project
        Parameters:
        newReq - The requirement to be added to the list of requirements in the project

      • getRequirement

        public Requirement getRequirement(int id)
        Returns the Requirement with the given ID
        Parameters:
        id - The ID number of the requirement to be returned
        Returns:
        the requirement for the id or null if the requirement is not found

      • removeRequirement

        public void removeRequirement(int removeId)
        Removes the requirement with the given ID
        Parameters:
        removeId - The ID number of the requirement to be removed from the list of requirements in the project

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Provides the number of elements in the list of requirements for the project. This function is called internally by the JList in NewRequirementPanel. Returns elements in reverse order, so the newest requirement is returned first.
        Returns:
        the number of requirements in the project *
        See Also:
        * @see javax.swing.ListModel#getSize() *, ListModel.getSize()

      • getNextID

        public int getNextID()
        Provides the next ID number that should be used for a new requirement that is created.
        Returns:
        the next open id number

      • getElementAt

        public Requirement getElementAt(int index)
        This function takes an index and finds the requirement in the list of requirements for the project. Used internally by the JList in NewRequirementModel.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the requirement to be returned
        Returns:
        the requirement associated with the provided index *
        See Also:
        *, *, ListModel.getElementAt(int)

      • emptyModel

        public void emptyModel()
        Removes all requirements from this model NOTE: One cannot simply construct a new instance of the model, because other classes in this module have references to it. Hence, we manually remove each requirement from the model.

      • addRequirements

        public void addRequirements(Requirement[] requirements)
        Adds the given array of requirements to the list
        Parameters:
        requirements - the array of requirements to add

      • getRequirements

        public java.util.List<Requirement> getRequirements()
        Returns the list of the requirements
        Returns:
        the requirements held within the requirementmodel.
